Description:
A DB2 Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for managing, maintaining, and optimizing IBM's DB2 databases at SECURA. This role is ideal for individuals with strong technical expertise in database systems, a keen eye for optimization, and a proactive approach to maintaining reliable and secure database environments. As we undergo our modernization journey this role will ensure that our DB2 environment remains performant and be involved in migrating to our newer technology stack.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Database Design and Architecture:
Design and implement DB2 databases to meet business requirements.
Optimize database schema, indexing, and query performance.
Database Maintenance:
Monitor database health, performance, and storage utilization.
Perform regular backups, recovery, and failover operations.
Apply patches, upgrades, and fixes to ensure system stability.
Performance Tuning:
Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
Implement best practices for database optimization and query tuning.
Security and Compliance:
Configure user roles, permissions, and access controls.
Ensure databases comply with organizational and regulatory security standards.
Troubleshooting:
Resolve database-related issues and outages.
Collaborate with developers, application teams, and infrastructure teams to diagnose problems.
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain detailed documentation of database configurations, processes, and procedures.
Generate reports for usage, performance, and capacity planning.

SKILLS AND TOOLS:
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in DB2 on z/OS.
Knowledge of SQL, stored procedures, Trusted Context, triggers, DB2 PureXML, and other database objects.
Familiarity with tools like IBM Data Studio and DB2 Query Monitor.
Performance Monitoring and Tuning:
Use tools for analyzing and optimizing performance.
Experience with database compression, partitioning, and clustering.
Backup and Recovery:
Expertise in database recovery methods.
Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills:
Ability to diagnose and resolve complex database issues effectively.
Strong task management and communication skills.

QUALIFICATIONS:

ESSENTIAL:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
5+ years expertise as a DB2 DBA

PREFERRED:
Certification in DB2 Database Administration (ex. IBM Certified Database Administrator) is a plus
SQL DBA experience

Responsibilities 
System Management: Configure and maintain the Yardi ERP system, including setting up new modules, updating existing modules, and ensuring system performance and reliability. • Technical Support: Provide technical support for Yardi users, troubleshoot and resolve system issues, and ensure timely resolution of user access problems.

Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of Yardi system procedures, configurations, and operations. 
Collaboration: Collaborate with IT staff to integrate Yardi ERP software with other business systems and ensure seamless data flow. 
Recommendations: Suggest improvements, upgrades, and new technologies to enhance the Yardi ERP system's capabilities.

Skills 
Strong knowledge of ERP systems, particularly Yardi, and experience with M365 applications. 
Advanced experience with databases and ability to query using SQL. 
Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. 
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively train and support end-users.

Solid understanding of customer service principles and the technical aspects required to support and explain complex concepts to non-technical users. 
Demonstrates strong analytical and technical skills, with the ability to break down and communicate complex information in a clear and user-friendly manner. 
Highly motivated and service-oriented, able to work effectively in a team environment, leveraging technical expertise and communication skills to deliver successful outcomes and maintain strong customer relationships. 
Qualifications 
Minimum five (5) years of technical experience as a Yardi administrator and five (5) years of experience in business systems applications, ideally in large real estate or regulated environments. 
Bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems, and/or computer science preferred. 
Preferred Qualifications

Position Description:
The Assistant Manager supports the Executive Director in implementing company programs by working directly with shift team and trainees to execute action plans that meet operational and organization objectives. The Assistant Manager is a hands-on, active member of the team serving with a passion for frontline engagement. The Assistant Manager reports to the Executive Director.
Essential Functions:
Providing leadership to shift team, actively works the floor alongside the team, maintaining proficiency as barista and cashier.
In close collaboration with the Talent Development Coordinator and Executive Director, ensures consistent implementation of an outcomes-oriented training program that progressively trains hard and soft skills.
Ensures effective store operations, filtering communication to the shift team as directed by the Executive Director.
Reviews store environment and key performance indicators to identify problems, concerns and opportunities for improvement in order to provide coaching and direction to the shift team to achieve operational goals. Communicates ideas to the Executive Director for broader areas of improvement.
Utilizes and provides direction to team during their shift on the use of operational tools to achieve operational excellence. Acts as a coach and mentor to team by using discretion in assessing performance, providing feedback and coaching to improve team performance, and effectively recommending employment decisions to Executive Director and Talent Development Coordinator.
Contributes to positive team environment by recognizing alarms or changes in team morale and performance and communicating them to the Executive Director.
Develops positive relationships with shift team by understanding and addressing individual motivation, needs and concerns.
Supports store operations by recognizing and reinforcing individual and team accomplishments through existing organizational tools and makes recommendations to Executive Director on new, creative, and impactful methods of recognition.
Serves as an effective, in-store ambassador for Inspired Coffee and people with disabilities.
Responds to immediate store needs by personally addressing or elevating high priority items to Executive Director.
Maintains proficiency as back-up for key operational functions including procurement of all supplies and consumables, staff scheduling, inventory management of retail merchandise, as well as other key functions of the Executive Director.
Manages merchandise inventory, secures stock from Inspiration Ministries’ storage facility and proactively communicates low inventory levels to trigger reorders.
Provides insights and recommendations for creative strategies to increase revenue and executes in-shop strategies (i.e. expand menu offerings).
Ensures all checklists, operating procedures, policies and systems are up to date, complete, and consistently followed.
Works closely with Executive Director and Inspiration Ministries’ Human Resources Manager to incorporate the use of volunteers.
Maintains full knowledge of all menu items, preparation techniques and recipes.
Has a passion for ensuring customers have an excellent and memorable guest experience, every time.
Primary Responsibilities
Floor operations/shift staff leadership
Assist Executive Director on execution of initiatives, strategies, etc.
Store performance – financial, key performance indicators
Support and ensure effectiveness of training program
Serve as leadership back-up for key operational functions, including: scheduling, inventory management, ordering, staffing/developing, training, weekly/monthly reporting, etc.
Skills and Core Competencies:
Strong moral character
Compassion – comfortable working with special needs population
Excellence
Guest experience-minded
Relational ability – friendly, high energy
Analytical thinking
Strong financial acumen

We offer remote work in the following approved states:

Have assisted in the maintenance of database policy and procedure documentation.
Enjoy providing support to application users for issues, including difficulties accessing database or acquiring data from database server.

Experience working in an environment that serves our nation’s military, veterans, Guard and Reserves, and Medicare beneficiaries.
Working in a continuous performance feedback environment.

Description:Build Your Future as a Salon Leader at Great Clips®!
At Peyton Company Great Clips®, we believe in empowering stylists to achieve their full potential. That's why we offer a dynamic career path filled with opportunity, support, and endless possibilities.
Here's what sets us apart:
Leadership Development: Refine your skills with comprehensive training programs designed to make you a confident and inspiring leader.
Stay Ahead of the Curve: Master the latest trends with ongoing education, ensuring you deliver exceptional service to every client.
Built-in Clientele: Focus on building connections, not your book! Great Clips boasts a steady stream of customers, ready for your expertise.
Technology to Empower: Leverage cutting-edge tools like Clip Notes® and Online Check-In to streamline operations and maximize your earning potential.
But it's not just about the numbers. Our mission is to cultivate a sense of comfort, freedom, and connection for every client. You'll play a vital role in fostering this positive atmosphere, ensuring customers return for all their hair care needs.
Ready to step into a leadership role that makes a real difference? Assistant Managers at Peyton Company Great Clips® will:
Champion Customer Care: Ensure every stylist delivers the exceptional 5 Steps to Customer Care program.
Lead by Example: Take charge during peak times, demonstrating our commitment to excellence.
Guide and Motivate: Be a role model and mentor, fostering a positive and supportive team environment.
Build the Dream Team: Recruit and hire talented stylists who share our passion for creating loyal customers.
Drive Growth and Success: Collaborate to achieve ambitious goals and celebrate salon victories.
Empower Your Team: Coach and develop your peers, helping them reach their full potential.
Problem-solving Pro: Tackle challenges head-on, ensuring efficient and smooth salon operations.
Cultivate a Fun Culture: Create a vibrant and enjoyable workplace where everyone thrives.
Safety First: Prioritize a safe and secure environment for all team members and clients.
Requirements:
Here's what we're looking for:
Licensed to Lead: Possess a current cosmetology, barber, or manager license (requirements vary by state/province).
Flexibility is Key: Thrive in a dynamic environment with a flexible schedule, including weekends and evenings.
Customer Champion: Be dedicated to delivering exceptional customer service that keeps clients coming back for more.
Leading by Example: Consistently demonstrate the 5 Steps to Customer Care, setting the standard for your team.
Technical Expertise: Deliver high-quality haircuts at a consistent pace in our fast-paced environment.
Active Listener: Possess a strong ability to understand and translate client desires into exceptional results.
Problem-solving Prowess: Effectively resolve customer concerns, ensuring a smooth and positive experience.
Tech-Savvy: Utilize computer systems efficiently to manage client information and streamline salon processes.
Leadership Essentials: Demonstrate strong employee management skills, including recruiting, training, development, motivation, and retention.
Team Player with a Vision: Lead a team committed to achieving company goals and upholding our core values.
Communication Master: Confidently present information both internally and externally.
Clear Communication: Strong fluency in reading and speaking English is essential.

Ready to commit to 34+ floor hours per week, including 5 weekend days per month? Then we want to hear from you!
Join the Peyton Company Great Clips® family and embark on a rewarding leadership journey. Contact us today!

Description:
Who are we?
A strategic and trusted insurance partner, Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI), provides a broad range of commercial property, casualty and specialty insurance coverages and outstanding service to customers and brokers around the world. Part of Berkshire Hathaway’s insurance operations, we bring our solutions to market with our stellar brand name, top-rated balance sheet and the expertise of our global team of professionals, who exude excellent capabilities and strong character.
We are a values-based organization where respect, integrity, excellence, collaboration, and passion define who we are and how we do business. We value diversity of backgrounds, experience and perspectives and strive to foster an inclusive environment that enables all our team members to bring their best selves to work. We are one team committed to building a culture where every teammate has the opportunity to contribute and be recognized. Want to be part of the team building the finest property, casualty, and specialty lines insurance company in the world?
Learn more about our unique culture and history.

Job Opportunity:
Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI) has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Enterprise DBA. We are searching for qualified candidates based in Boston, MA or Stevens Point, Wisconsin. This position will require strong technical problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills. The ability to work, make decisions, and manage projects, both independently, and within a dynamic team environment, is crucial. The Enterprise DBA role supports a growing global organization and may require periodic night and weekend work. An initial technical screening followed by a formal interview process will take place once management expresses interest in a candidate.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Install, configure, and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring system health and performance, to ensure high levels of security, performance, availability, and resilience.
Design, develop, implement, and maintain processes using T-SQL, PowerShell, Azure Data Factory and SSIS.
Define and Implement data access controls and monitoring.
Respond promptly to and resolve database-related alerts, emails, and tickets.
Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real-time, providing end-to-end problem resolution.
Maintain schema changes and scripts using version control (Visual Studio, TFS, DevOps).
Work with teams that are geographically dispersed and comprised of all disciplines, such as architects, business analysts, developers, and testers.
Assist developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement.
Follow established team standards. For any gap, recommend new or updated standards. Be proactive in identifying areas of improvement.
Document and update processes and procedures when appropriate.
Take ownership, support, and follow through on assigned deliverables, adjusting well to changes in priority.
Develop accurate estimates of effort and timelines. Ensure that all assignments are completed accurately and within approved delivery schedules.
Demonstrate a willingness and commitment to learn.
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities, including off-hours.
At times provide off-hours support, including weekends and holidays, on rotation.
Other duties may be assigned, directed or requested.
Qualifications, Skills and Experience:
Minimum of three (8) years of MS SQL Server database administration experience, demonstrating experience/knowledge of typical DBA tasks, including:
Backups, restores, recovery models, patching, disaster recovery
Implementation, configuration, troubleshooting, maintenance
Security, data and schema standards and concepts
Performance Tuning & Optimization, indexes, index management, and statistics
Strong proficiency with T-SQL programming (joins, views, stored procedures, functions, etc.), database design and optimization techniques
Proficient on OLTP / OLAP / ER Diagrams / Internal Engine / Index Tuning / Statistics / Execution Plans / SP Optimization / Partitioning / Normalization / Denormalization
Five (5) or more years of hands-on working knowledge Azure and MS SQL Server
MariaDB, PostgreSQL, etc.
Hands-on working knowledge in MariaDB, MySQL and PostgreSQL databases desired
Experience working with Enterprise Data Warehouse teams and Data Analytics teams preferred

BHSI Offers:
A competitive package and exciting growth opportunities for career-oriented teammates
A dynamic, action oriented and thoughtful environment centered on always doing the right thing for our customers, teammates, and our other stakeholders
A purposely non-bureaucratic organization that embraces simplicity over complexity and emphasizes individual excellence in a team framework
NOTE: Compensation will be commensurate with experience. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Team Member may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
Title: Enterprise Database Administrator (DBA)

Description:
POSITION PURPOSE

The IT Intern - Database Administrator will directly support the IT department within the DBA team engagements. The ideal candidate will have experience with standard technical skills and be enrolled in an associate, undergraduate or graduate degree program in the areas of Information Technology or Computer Science.

WORK SCHEDULE
Interns will work full-time (40 hours/week) during the summer months, starting mid-May through early September on a hybrid basis with some remote capabilities
Upon successful completion of summer term, additional availability to work part-time (15-20 hours/week) during the fall and spring semesters will be available based on business needs

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES
Understand and engage with Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) with Oracle and Microsoft SQL Servers
Review and design documentation to support DBA team engagement with application and business teams
Learn and execute tasks to assess, maintain and support databases such as patches, monitoring and turning activities
Participate in regularly scheduled team meetings

QUALIFICATIONS
High school degree or equivalent; must be enrolled in an accredited university or college program, preferred area of studies around Information Technology or Computer Science.
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite
Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas
Strong business acumen, communication, and interpersonal skills
Demonstrated analytical, problem solving, and critical thinking skills
Must be able to work effectively in a team environment

BENEFITS OF AN INTERNSHIP WITH MGE
Local employer - accessible via bike paths, bus lines, and we have free on-site parking
Hands-on projects - meaningful projects and experience across business functions
Competitive pay - interns are paid fairly for the work they contribute
Opportunity for full-time employment - high conversion rate from internship to full-time employment after graduation

About the Organization

MGE is a community energy company dedicated to planning and providing reliable energy that balances the needs and values of those we serve. MGE has been in the top three most reliable electric utilities in the nation for the past 14 years. MGE is an investor-owned, government-regulated public utility that generates and distributes electric power to 157,000 customers and purchases and distributes natural gas to 166,000 customers in south-central and western Wisconsin. MGE's parent company is MGE Energy, Inc., a public utility holding company. Its common stock trades on the NASDAQ Stock Market. For more information, visit mge.com and mgeenergy.com.

Job Location

The position is hybrid, and office days are in downtown Madison, Wisconsin, where MGE is an active participant in community efforts to preserve the area's extraordinary quality of life. Madison is the capital of Wisconsin and a major research and technology city. The area's strong quality-of-life factors include a vibrant economy; urban, suburban, and rural living options; nationally acclaimed public university and public secondary school systems; rich cultural, recreational, and outdoor offerings; and a favorable cost of living.

Description:
Are you passionate about data and have an interest in working cloud based data solutions? Want to contribute to a growing financial services firm who values IT as a partner to the business? Consider the Database Administrator position at Baird!

The Baird IT Operations team is looking for an energetic individual that enjoys problem-solving and making a difference as we deliver excellent service today and leverage Cloud and Next-Generation database technologies going forward. We are looking for an articulate professional with integrity, focus, and a clear determination to make things better every day.

As a Database Administrator, you will:
Investigate and learn new and emerging database technologies (e.g. Azure data technologies) with an eye to selecting and implementing the right solution for project teams and the business.
Build, configure, and administer new database servers, databases, objects, and ETL as required to support the business.
Monitor current databases and database servers for performance, stability, and scalability.
Develop and implement improvement plans for performance and standards
Communicates and collaborates with project delivery teams to ensure implementation of best practices and continuous improvement.
Mentor delivery teams on best practices
Ability to work in a 24x7 support environment, participate in an on-call rotation, and have experience responding to client needs as raised in Service Desk tickets.


What makes this opportunity great:
Opportunity to be thought and practice leader as we evolve Baird's data capabilities in the DevOps, Cloud, and Business Intelligence spaces
Information technology is a core part of Baird's business strategy and plays a critical role in the growth and transformation of the firm.
Collaborative culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives while emphasizing teamwork and a strong sense of partnership
Support and flexibility to grow and be your best at work, at home, and in the community


What we look for:

WHAT THIS ROLE NEEDS:
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Our great Fortune 500 client in Franklin, WI has an immediate opening for a DB2 DBA.
Partners with information architects, application architects, clients and project teams to develop, maintain and integrate information logical models. Designs physical models and works with database administration to facilitate the creation and maintenance of physical databases. Typically 5-8 years of experience in the role
As a Database Engineer, you support database systems including analysis, planning, design, development, implementation, and upgrades. Applying established best practices, you will take charge of complex systems to achieve strategic objectives in the areas of service management, risk management and feature delivery. You will:
Execute detail database design tasks and create associated deliverables
Provide estimates of work for database build and configuration
Consult on right-sizing decisions for database solutions
Transition database build and configuration work to the Service Operation DBA
Collaborate with the other Infrastructure Engineering and Operations database administrators, as well as application developers and data specialists, on database design, configuration, and performance issues
Assist with the assessment of varying types of incidents, providing subject matter expertise as needed
As a strategic thinker, move between diverse tasks with cooperation and persistence, helping to bring out the best in those around you
Qualifications
WHAT THIS ROLE NEEDS:
Minimum 3 years' experience in Database Administration
Recent experience with DB2LUW, and Unix
Basic scripting knowledge: Unix shell scripting
Knowledge of other database technologies is a plus
Basic awareness of other infrastructure technologies - for example, Websphere, Business Objects, Unix server administration, storage, or data networking
Ability to develop standard operating plans and procedures and coach others in their use
Experience with the application of DB2 LUW database patches
Experience with database tools and monitors preferably Toad
Service Management (ITIL)
Ability to develop estimates for support or projects
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with immediate team members, other IS areas, and clients in other departments
Ability to set priorities for scope, risk and quality of technology solutions to meet business needs
Ability to effectively communicate issues and solutions across all levels of the organization
Experience or willingness to learn how to work within agile delivery frameworks (like SCRUM, SAFe, XP, Kanban etc...)
Ability to influence and coach peers
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Description:
For those who want to invent the future of health care, here's your opportunity. We're going beyond basic care to health programs integrated across the entire continuum of care. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.

The Director of Database Administration will lead a small team of database administrators and data engineers, leveraging a combination of technical expertise and leadership skills to ensure the stability, performance, and scalability of our SQL Platform infrastructure. This leadership position is responsible for the strategic direction, high-level architectural solutions, and the operational excellence of our database systems, including Always-On High Availability, Disaster Recovery, and migration to other systems such as Azure and PostgreSQL.

You'll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities:

Provide strategic leadership and direction to a team of database administrators and data engineers. Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment through effective coaching, mentoring, and performance management
Design, optimize, and implement high-level architectural solutions across the SQL Platform infrastructure. Ensure that the database systems are scalable, reliable, and meet the performance requirements of the business
Develop and maintain robust disaster recovery plans and ensure high availability of the database systems. Implement and manage Always-On High Availability solutions to support the business continuity plans
Analyze and optimize the enterprise database server infrastructure to ensure maximum performance and stability. Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks and implement best practices to enhance system performance
Lead the migration efforts to other systems such as Azure and PostgreSQL. Collaborate with the Data Engineering team to integrate new solutions seamlessly into the existing ecosystem
Communicate effectively at both business and technical levels. Work closely with stakeholders including business units, infrastructure teams, and the Technical Command Center to understand requirements and deliver solutions that meet their needs
Collaborate with Principal Data Engineers to architect and implement solutions for future growth. Stay abreast of the latest industry trends and technologies to ensure that our database infrastructure remains cutting-edge
Ensure that all database systems comply with industry regulations and security standards. Implement security measures to protect sensitive data and maintain data integrity

You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:

7+ years of experience in database administration, with a focus on SQL Server, Azure, and PostgreSQL
5+ years of experience in a leadership role managing a team of database administrators and data engineers
5+ years of experience with experience in design, implementation, and management of SQL Server High Availability Groups with disaster recovery on SQL Server 2016 or higher
3+ years of experience with the architecture and management of enterprise level SQL Server Always-On High Availability groups. (SQL 2016 or higher)
3+ years of experience with data security with regards to Confidential Unclassified Information
2+ years of experience with SQL waits, locking, blocking and resource contention
2+ years of experience with database performance optimization
2+ years of experience with migration projects, particularly to cloud-based systems such as Azure
United States Citizenship
If you are offered this position, you will be required to provide extensive personal information to obtain and maintain a suitability or determination of eligibility for a Confidential/Secret or Top Secret security clearance as a condition of your employment

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Advanced certifications in database management or related fields
2+ years of experience with federal contracts, including STIG, NIST, SOC auditing, CUI, PII/PHI
2+ years of experience with change management systems, such as ServiceNow and Jira
2+ years of experience with other database systems and platforms beyond SQL Server, Azure, and PostgreSQL

Description:
Trianz is a leading-edge technology platforms and services company that accelerates digital transformations at Fortune 100 and emerging companies worldwide in data & analytics, digital experiences, cloud infrastructure, and security. The company has developed a disruptive “IP Led Transformations” vision, strategy, and business model over the past 3 years. Some of the company’s IP was recently acquired by AWS and its overall business model has taken off sharply in 2024.
Trianz is led by Sri Manchala, a former special forces officer from the Indian army and author of Crossing the Digital Faultline | Trianz, and a team of veterans from well-known firms such as Deloitte, HCL, KPMG, Wipro, Microsoft, TATA, AWS, GE, etc. 
About Trianz
Trianz believes that companies around the world face three challenges in their digital transformation journeys - shrinking ‘time to transform’ due to competition & AI, lack of digital-ready talent, and uncertain economic conditions. To help clients leapfrog over these challenges, Trianz has built IP and platforms that have transformed the adoption of the cloud, data, analytics & insights AI.
Specifically, the following Trianz platforms are changing the way companies approach transformations in various disciplines:
Concierto: A fully automated platform to Migrate, Manage, and Maximize the multi & hybrid cloud. A zero code and SaaS platform, Concierto allows teams to migrate to AWS, Azure and GCP and manage them efficiently from a single pane of glass. Visit www.concierto.cloud for more information.
Avrio: is a Data to AI SaaS platform designed to drive data-led transformation at lightning speed. Through conversational AI, organizations seamlessly engage with all their data, unlocking real-time insights, and uncovering hidden opportunities and risks—all within one powerful platform. Visit www.avriodata.ai to know more.
Pulse: Recognizing that workforces will be distributed, mobile, and fluid, Trianz has built a ‘future of work’ digital workplace platform called Pulse. Visit www.trianz.com/Pulse
Since the market launch of this strategy in mid-2023, Trianz has experienced enormous growth, success and recognition.
Some of Trianz’ built IP in data and analytics was acquired by Amazon. Since then, Trianz has been made an engineering partner of Amazon for building/supporting connected ecosystems across multiple AWS platforms.
Most recently, Trianz and AWS have signed a strategic collaboration agreement within which the two companies will work on joint roadmaps/solutions for the cloud; AWS will buy Trianz | Concierto in bulk for AWS partners to use for migrations; AWS will also recommend Concierto to their MSPs and finally, AWS Professional Services and Trianz have signed an agreement for joint solutioning and customer delivery. Read more: Trianz enters into a Strategic Collaboration Agreement with AWS to Revolutionize Cloud Adoption and Management (yahoo.com)
 Given all this, Trianz is experiencing a significant demand for its SW platforms and consequent growth. To support this growth, Trianz has recently raised private equity capital to scale the company over the next several years (Trianz Announces Strategic Growth Capital Investment by Capital Square Partners (prnewswire.com). It is now bolstering its senior and mid-level leadership with top talent across GTM, Engineering, Services, and Partnership organizations. We are seeking leaders driven by our purpose - to help customers accelerate digital transformations and build the next generation software and services organization.

Oracle Apps DBA
Employment Type: Fulltime/Contract                 
Contract 1 year
Work location: Remote/Onsite (mention no. of Onsite days)

About the Role       
Trianz is looking for an Oracle Apps DBA with good understanding of Oracle database and Oracle Applications 11i and R12/R12.2 concepts, architecture, related utilities, and tools.
        Job Responsibilities       
•            Installation, configuration and upgrading of Oracle server software and related products.

 3. Coordinates with ABK manager on sculpting/repair/grinding of client projects.*

 6. Assists with onsite project installations.*
 7. Responsible for following proper procedures for handling materials and equipment.*
 8. Performs other duties as assigned.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 Language Ability:
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.
 Math Ability:
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
 Reasoning Ability:
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

· Prioritization skills
· Multi-tasking skills

· Listening skills
· Professionalism

 Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, use hands, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, talk or hear, and taste or smell. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, ability to adjust focus, and ability to see color.
 Work Environment:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to wet or humid conditions (non-weather), work near moving mechanical parts, work in high, precarious places, fumes or airborne particles, and outdoor weather conditions.
 The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Antlers By Klaus is a quality driven company, with a reputation for excellence. We build corporate and private wildlife habitat displays throughout the US. Antlers By Klaus features a fast-paced, creative environment, with very interesting and unique outdoor related products.

Summary
The responsibilities of a Server in our restaurant are to greet guests, seat them down, help them with menu recommendations, take and deliver orders (carry trays), and clear tables. All our servers are also responsible for handling cash and credit card transactions.

To help our restaurant provide a pleasurable dining experience, a good server should be able to ensure that our guests are fully satisfied by being friendly, courteous, accommodating, and reliable. A suitable candidate for the job should also be a problem-solver and a team player.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities including the following:
Greeting, seating, and escorting guests.
Providing menu recommendations and additional information.
Upselling additional products when appropriate.
Helping guests with menu recommendations.
Taking orders using software, order slips, or by memorization.
Communicating order details to the kitchen staff.
Delivering food and beverages in a timely fashion.
Delivering checks and collecting bill payments.
Cleaning and maintaining the appearance of tables and tableware.
Providing exceptional customer experience.
Develop and maintain professional and functional working relationships with IHOP employees and customers.
Execute the service success steps – Service Excellence
Perform Food Safety Evaluations (FSE), LTO Training, A/B Status, Operations Excellence (OE), Health Department Inspections (HDI) per the IHOP SOP.
Execute the Guest Relations for NGC – Normalized Guest Complaints Index per the IHOP SOP to ensure the quality guest experience.
Handle guest complaints in a timely manner, inquire about the quality of the dining experience, thank customers and invite them to return.
Memorize and apply IHOP terminology, abbreviations, methodologies, plating, and menu knowledge.
Comply with SOP methods of creating guest checks and maintaining cash control.
Stock and rotate all needed supplies in the service area and the dining room.
Comply with all local and SOP health, sanitation, and safety guidelines.
Check restrooms hourly to ensure proper stock levels and cleanliness.
Clear, clean, manicure, re-set tables, clean chairs, booths, and floors.
Perform all cleaning duties according to posted cleaning charts.
Comply with IHOP uniform and appearance standards per the IHOP SOP guidelines.
Perform other assignments or tasks as assigned by the General Manager, Assistant Manager, or acting supervisor.

Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative to those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Requirements:
Prior experience as a server is a plus.
Must showcase teamwork and communication skills.
Must be able to handle money transactions responsibly.
Must be able to multitask and act quickly.
Must be flexible and ready to work in shifts.
Must be a team player.
Qualifications
To provide this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and/or Experience
No prior experience or training is required.
Language Skills
Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write guest checks and simple correspondence. Ability to read and speak English well enough to understand guest checks, communicate with customers, and read instructions, warning and safety labels.
Mathematical Skills
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
Reasoning Ability
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Other Skills and Abilities
IHOP training course work as assigned.
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, talk, and hear. The employee is required to frequently use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or moved up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and distance vision.
Title: Server / Expeditor Job Description

Description:
Expertise in the cloud compatible DBMS - Oracle / MS SQL
Ability to provision and configure database instances in the cloud environment, including selecting the appropriate database type, storage, and network settings.
Knowledge of cloud networking concepts, including Virtual Private Cloud (VPC), subnets, security groups, and network peering, to ensure secure and performant communication between database instances and other services.
Proficiency in using automation tools and Infrastructure as Code frameworks (e.g., AWS CloudFormation, Azure Resource Manager, Terraform) to provision and manage cloud database resources.
Knowledge of various backup and recovery methods to ensure data is protected and can be restored in case of data loss or system failure
Proficiency in writing and optimizing SQL queries to retrieve, manipulate, and manage data within the database.
Ability to install and set up the DBMS software, configure database parameters, and establish security settings.
Knowledge of database security measures, including user authentication, access controls, encryption, and auditing.
Database Installation and Configuration: Installing Oracle software and setting up the database environment. This includes configuring database parameters, creating tablespaces, and setting up security measures.
Database Maintenance and Monitoring: Regularly monitoring the database to ensure optimal performance and identifying and resolving any issues that arise. This involves managing database storage, performing backups, and implementing recovery procedures.
Performance Tuning: Identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks to optimize database performance. This may involve tuning SQL queries, optimizing indexes, and adjusting configuration parameters.
Backup and Recovery: Implementing backup and recovery strategies to safeguard against data loss and to recover the database in case of failures.
Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution: Diagnosing and resolving database-related problems, such as errors, data corruption, and connectivity issues.
Disaster Recovery: Implementing disaster recovery procedures to ensure business continuity in case of a catastrophic event.
Patch Management and Upgrades: Keeping the database software up-to-date by applying patches and upgrades to fix bugs, enhance performance, and add new features.
Title: Senior Oracle DBA

Job Title: Certified DB2 Administrator (z/OS and LUW)
Location: 350 Sunny Slope Road, Brookfield, WI 53005
Job Description: As Certified DB2 Administrator (z/OS and LUW)/ Senior Database Administrator, will provide recommendations on using the latest DB2 features for improving application performance, as well as identify traditional methods of maintenance activities and convert them to modern maintenance, further reducing CPU, storage and high performance to applications. Participate in the technical design process as it relates to database implementations, review technical documents, and communicate any risks or issues using the appropriate escalation procedures. Provide direction for standards and procedures for monitoring, capacity planning, tuning, maintenance, performance optimization, backups, and recovery ensuring infrastructure will meet capacity requirements to deliver projects on time. Plan, install, configure, maintain, and monitor database software and other associated software tools. Collaborate with the production application support team to keep all online and batch applications from breaking, keeping down time to a minimum. Perform DB2 changes as part of new releases into Development, UAT, Stage, Pre Production, and Production regions through BMC Remedy ticketing system. Provide level 2 support for production tickets and support user queries in UAT, Pre-Production, and Production environments through BMC Remedy ticketing system. Support the development, system testing, end user, and the production support team in resolving and providing solutions to DB2 related issues utilizing DB2 specific debugging tools including DB2PD, DB2TOP, DB2DIAG, and other various IBM debug tools to provide long term fixes. Provide new features of DB2 to the application development team, test and implement any new features with respect to the database. Produce, deliver, and maintain appropriate documentation for UDB DB2 database in accordance document control standards and procedures. Up to 60% telecommuting permitted.
Education Requirement: Bachelor’s degree in CS, IT or related
Experience Requirement: 7 years of experience as a database administrator, DB2 database administrator, software developer or related
Special Skills: Must have work experience with each of the following: 1) DB2 LUW HADR; 2) DB2 Performance and Log Analysis; 3) DB2 on Pure Scale; 4) DB2 Mainframe and Application DBA; and 5) DB2 Mainframe and System DBA. Up to 60% telecommuting permitted.
Salary Range: $118,664 – $140,000
Apply: https://betanxt.com/careers/
Referral Policy: This position qualifies for BetaNXT’s employee referral program

General Summary: Provides administrative support by assisting the Head and Assistant Head of Preschool and Lower School, faculty, and staff by performing complex and confidential administrative or clerical duties. Performs tasks while working with limited supervision and making work priority decisions in accordance with established policies, practices, and regulations. Serves as a liaison between students, parents, teachers, and administration.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Acts as the division receptionist. Answers the telephone, takes messages, supplies requested information, or refers calls to the proper party as necessary.
Keeps the Head of Pre and Lower School and the Assistant Head of Lower School’s calendar.
Gathers and maintains data in reference to student attendance and scheduling.
Arranges meeting times and space usage/rentals for the Lower School.
Handles inquiries from teachers, students, parents, and the general public.
Assist parents with parent-teacher conferences sign-up process.
Reconciles division credit card.
Maintains files and confidential information.
Uses various software programs and databases.
Creates the Preschool and Lower School class schedule for each year based on enrollment and class offerings.
Creates special day and assembly schedules throughout the school year.
Assigns the coverage of classes from within when a substitute teacher is not available.
Coordinates responsibilities with the division in-house substitute teacher.
Oversees substitutes from Teacher’s on Call.
Files and maintains office correspondence, records, charts, etc.
Coordinates purchasing and supplies, maintains stock level and storage.
Analyzes records and systems, and devises suggestions for improvement of office procedures, methods, and record keeping.
Prepares all onboarding information and on boards any students who miss the actual dates.
Sets up all faculty drops in and observations.
Works with the Middle School to ensure smooth transition of crossover students.
Complies Index reporting materials and data.
Sets up report cards and grade plans in myUSM.
Manages A-H calendar setup in myUSM.
Updates and maintains various Preschool and Lower School calendars.
Manages the LS parent resource webpage.
Works with parents and other schools to send or collect student records.
Assists in closing ceremony preparation.
Plans and organizes special events in the Preschool and Lower School.
Works collaboratively with faculty, staff, and administration to meet diverse needs.
Completes other tasks as deemed appropriate by the administration.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Excellent computer skills; capable of competently operating technology.
Ability to work collaboratively with others and maintain positive professional relationships.

High level of maturity, confidentiality, and assertiveness.
Capable of using tact and diplomacy in dealing with others.

High School Diploma minimum; associate’s or college degree preferred.
Experience as an administrative assistant in an educational setting is preferred.

Description:
VCA Milwaukee Emergency Center for Animals (MECA) in Greenfield, WI is seeking a Certified Veterinary Technician to join the team at our one-of-kind emergency hospital.
Schedule: Full time, day shift (6:00 am-6:00 pm). 12-hour shifts, 3 shifts per week ( 3 x 12 hour ). Alternating weekends and rotating holidays are required.
Compensation: Starting range is determined by skill set and years of experience in the field.
Why We Want You:
Come put your passion for patient care to work! Our technicians practice in a fast-paced environment, handling a mix of urgent, emergency and critical care cases. Every day, you will have the opportunity to practice, enhance and improve you skills, including:
Triage:Perform an initial assessment to evaluate the patient's condition quickly. This includes checking vital signs, assessing for obvious injuries or distress, and gathering information from the pet owner about the situation.
Assist Doctors: Collaborate closely with veterinarians to assist in exams, treatments, and medical procedures for emergency cases.
Venipuncture and IVC Placement: Proficiently perform venipuncture, intravenous catheter placement, and grow your advanced vascular access techniques
Medication Administration: Safely and accurately administer fluids, medications, and other treatments as prescribed by veterinarians.
Team Collaboration: Work in conjunction with all technical staff across the hospital to ensure hospitalized patients receive optimal care. Maintain open communication with the healthcare team.
Nursing Care: Vigilantly monitor hospitalized patients, identifying subtle changes in their clinical status. Participate in departmental rounds and manage the maintenance of urinary catheters, nasogasrtic tubes, chest and abdominal tubes, as well as nasal oxygen tubes.
Client Education: Provide clear and concise discharge instructions to clients, ensuring they understand the care their furry family member requires after leaving the hospital.
Anesthesia and Sedation Monitoring: Prepare patients for procedures and monitor anesthesia to ensure patient safety.
Diagnostic Imaging: Operate diagnostic imaging equipment and assist in capturing radiographs and other diagnostic images.
Laboratory Procedures: Run diagnostics, correlate results with the clinical presentation of the patient and notify Veterinarian of results.
Administering Oxygen:Flow-by Oxygen, Nasal Oxygen Cannula, or Oxygen Cage.
Plus More!
Who We Are:
VCA MECA has been serving the Milwaukee community since 2009. We are open 24/7 to provide emergency and critical care services to a diverse patient base of dogs, cats, small mammals, reptiles and birds. We utilize a collaborative approach to veterinary medicine, with a team dedicated to providing high quality care to pets facing illness and injury.
Full-time VCA Associates enjoy a robust compensation and benefits package, including:
Access to the people and financial resources of a large veterinary community
Leadership opportunities and Career Development Programs
Opportunities to give back through strong Shelter partnerships and VCA Charities
CE allowance, Vet Tech license reimbursement, and NAVTA membership
Free mental wellness subscriptions (Head Space and 12 Lyra Health Sessions)
Referral bonuses
Medical, dental & vision insurance for you and your family
Life, long and short-term disability insurance included
Paid parental leave
Paid vacation (2 weeks in 1st year for CVTs), sick time, and holiday pay
401(k) with corporate match
Pet care discounts (40-100%)
Associate-led equity, inclusion, and diversity groups
Free Continuing Education through our online WoofU
Associate discounts on major cell phone carriers, car rentals, entertainment, and more!
Plus so much more!
Join Our Team:
If you are passionate about emergency and critical care, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are excited about being part of a growing team, we would love to hear from you! New Veterinary Technician Grads are encouraged to apply!
Apply Today!
Keywords: Veterinary Medicine, Veterinary Technician, Vet Tech, ICU, ER
Address: 3670 S 108th St, Greenfield, WI 53228
If you are a current associate, you need to apply through our internal career site. Please log into Workday and click on the Jobs Hub app or search for Browse Jobs.
Benefits: We offer competitive compensation along with a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision and paid vacation/sick days, 401(k), generous employee pet discounts and more!
The information in this position description indicates the general nature and level of work to be performed. It is not designed to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of associates assigned to this job. Management reserves the right to revise the job description or require that other tasks be performed when the circumstances of the job change (for example, emergencies, change in personnel, workload, or technical development).
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - Veterans / Disabled. For a complete EEO statement please see our career page at vcacareers.com.
Title: Emergency Veterinary Technician

Description:
The Technical Consultant is responsible for providing expert-level technical support and consulting services to clients utilizing WennSoft solutions. This role requires a strong understanding of database structures, software customization, and integration methodologies. The consultant will be instrumental in ensuring clients maximize the value of their WennSoft investments through effective implementation, ongoing support, and continuous improvement.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Software Customization:
Analyze client business requirements and translate them into customized solutions within the WennSoft platform.
Configure and customize WennSoft solutions to meet specific client needs, including workflows, user permissions, and reporting.
Develop and implement custom reports using built-in reporting tools and potentially external reporting tools.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues related to software functionality and customizations.
Software Upgrades:
Plan and execute software upgrades and migrations, ensuring minimal disruption to client operations.
Test and validate upgraded systems to ensure functionality and data integrity.
Provide comprehensive documentation and training to clients on upgraded features.
Database Administration:
Potentially act as a database administrator for the WennSoft solutions, including performance tuning, and security maintenance.
Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues.
API Integration:
Design and implement integrations with other software systems using APIs.
Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure successful integration projects.
Develop and maintain documentation for all integrations.
Client Support:
Provide ongoing technical support to clients via phone, email, and remote access.
Proactively identify and address client needs and concerns.
Build and maintain strong client relationships.
Training and Documentation:
Develop and deliver training materials and presentations to clients on various aspects of the WennSoft solutions.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all customizations, integrations, and support procedures.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
3+ years of experience working with database systems
Proven experience with software customization and configuration.
Experience with API integration and development.
C# development proficiency required
.NET add-ins development proficiency required.
Strong understanding of software development lifecycle principles.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Role: DBA (ETL/Informatica)

JOB Description

The role is responsible for the design, development, coding, testing, debugging and documentation of data-warehouse/database/business intelligence applications.

Duties include hands-on new development as well as support, maintenance, or enhancement of existing applications.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Design and implement ETL (Informatica) process using SQL, ETL tool and Linux shell scripting to deliver high quality solutions.
Strong data analysis, advance SQL query writing skill and resolving the defects by working across multiple teams
Collaborate with other development teams to manage interdependency, set up test cases, debug and maintain data quality.
Ensure software stability via documentation, code reviews, regression, unit and user acceptance testing.
Hands on logical and physical data modeling and database design responsibilities.
Good understanding of Dimensional modeling
Be able to lead and develop Informatica PowerCenter ETL complex flows connecting to heterogenous database such as oracle/MS SQL server.
Develop complex oracle procedures ,functions, and packages to support database applications(API calls / DW reporting )
Conduct both proactive and reactive performance tuning activities during course of development of new applications and existing legacy applications.
Hands on experience to develop and support Unix Shell Scripting.
Should have understanding of scheduler (Autosys)
Perform data analysis and data profiling. Identify data quality


Required Skills
Participate and guide team in estimating work necessary to realize a story/requirement through the delivery lifecycle.
Contribute to story refinement/defining requirements.
Perform spike/proof of concept as necessary to mitigate risk or implement new ideas.
Code solutions and unit test to deliver a requirement/story per the defined acceptance criteria and compliance requirements.
Utilize multiple architectural components (across data, application, business) in design and development of client requirements.
Assist team with resolving technical complexities involved in realizing story work.
Experience Informatica or other ETL tool
Professional experience with SQL/PLSQL
Understand Data Federations, Data Lake, Data Mesh and Advance Cloud concepts.
Experience automating ETL with job scheduling tools. Autosys Preferred
Experience working with large data sets using big data solutions such as Hadoop, Spark etc. is a plus
Demonstrate exceptional analytical skills and problem solving skills; excellent organizational, communication skills
A good team-player who seeks input and involves others in his/her communications; a person who values and cultivates relationships.
An individual with a demonstrated ability to get things done and make things happen; a person who is resourceful, seizes opportunities and is an innovator.

Desired Skills
Document and communicate required information for deployment, maintenance, support, and business functionality.
Strong experience in Informatica, Datawarehousing, data architecture, databases and writing/optimizing advanced SQL queries in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
Contribute to existing test suites (integration, regression, performance),analyze test reports, identify any test issues/errors, and triage the underlying cause.
Using Trino, Starburst or similar vendor tool exposure would be a plus.

Description:
POSITION SUMMARY The Geographic Information System (GIS) Administrator develops, administers, and supports Eau Claire County's GIS Program and division staff. The position determines the design and architecture for the County's Enterprise GIS including cadastral data standards, Next Generation 911 data accuracy, and project management. QUALIFICATIONS Serves as chair of Eau Claire County's Land Information Council and holds appointment as Land Information Officer as specified in 16.967(7); plans for computerized integration of land records (Land Information Plan) with other systems both within the county and state-wide; prepares annual applications; administers land records grants in accord with 59.72 of the Wisconsin Statutes; serves as liaison contact with the Wisconsin Department of Administration
Incorporates comprehensive knowledge of geography, cartography, and GIS theories, principals, and standard best practices to administer the county's GIS Program including system design, development, implementation, maintenance, support, testing, and training for the Enterprise System. Directs knowledge of the principles and practices of supervision to participate in decisions on hiring, retention, discipline, and other personnel matters; supervises and manages activities of staff that includes determining work procedures and schedules and developing methods for expediting workflow; approves employee requests for leave and overtime as required by operational necessity; evaluates employee performance; coaches and counsels staff to achieve improved performance and productivity; recommends corrective disciplinary action as needed; identifies individual training needs in order to achieve greater departmental performance and productivity. Maintains knowledge of and proficiency in operating multiple databases, programming applications, and software to enhance the efficiency of the Division through use of automated functions; works in the ESRI software platform including ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal), and ArcGIS Online, MS SQL, Visual Studio, Python, Arcade, and other GIS software.
Creates, updates, and maintains spatial and attribute databases; develops links to associated county data for availability in the Eau Claire County GIS and Land Information System (LIS) environments, and on the internet using standardized procedures. Controls GIS Server administration and GIS and Database Management System (DBMS) maintenance; grants and removes user permissions; authorizes and configures countywide software license; implements appropriate backup procedures. Establishes priorities and resources for systems modifications and data development requests.
Ensures system integration with other county computer systems; cooperates with other departments providing GIS expertise. Adheres to standard record keeping guidelines for public access; maintains open records public access to GIS data, both online and through data distribution agreements, in cooperation with the Information Systems Department and external consultants. Analyzes GIS requirements; prepares documentation reflecting procedures; prepares program specifications conforming to established mapping standards.
Performs data conversion and integration; interprets legal land descriptions, transfers descriptions, geographic data, and Public Land Survey System (PLSS) data into cartographic representations. Prepares thematic and comprehensive maps for analysis, quality control, presentations, and distribution. Responsible for the development and delivery of user training on new system functionality or system upgrade changes.
Identifies, analyzes, troubleshoots, recommends modifications, and resolves GIS technology and PC hardware and software issues. Demonstrates expertise with Global Positions System (GPS) equipment and data collection methods; assists with the research, evaluation, and deployment of GPS hardware and software upgrades and latest information technologies. Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with internal and external partners; provide technical assistance and guidance to other county departments to meet their GIS needs; collaborates with external vendors and county staff to define system requirements, resolve application issues, and implement technical solutions; assists the public in the search of geographic/land information.
Updates and maintains the county's online GIS website and Apps. Attends training, seminars, workshops, conferences, and meetings. Performs other related work as required or assigned.
TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL EXEPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in geography, GIS, computer sciences, or related field. Three (3) years of experience with Esri software platform including ArcGIS Prog, ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal), and ArcGIS Online, version database editing, database replication, database design and development. Two (2) years of experience publishing and managing feature services and using ArcGIS Online/Enterprise to develop and share web maps for use in Field Maps, Web AppBuilder, and similar programs.
Two (2) years of progressively responsible experience in GIS project management. Two (2) years of experience with one or more of the following: cadastral mapping,?NG-911 Addressing data, or the PLSS. Experience with MS SQL and Visual Studio or other DBMS.
Appointment will be conditional upon successful completion of a criminal background check. Must have a valid driver's license and an acceptable driving record. Must possess and maintain personal automobile insurance in the amount of $100,000/$300,000.
DESIRED TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL EXERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS Master's degree in geography, GIS, computer sciences, or related field. Five (5) years of related experience with Esri software platform including ArcGIS Prog, ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal), and ArcGIS Online. Two (2) years supervisory experience.
GIS Certificate Program from an accredited college or university.

Description

Why work for us?

Established in 2015, Jensen Castings is a family-owned company dedicated to handcrafting products here in the USA. With a focus on concrete, steel, and glass fiber reinforced concrete (GFRC), we design and fabricate outdoor gas fire tables and fire bowls. Our modern, streamlined designs have become a favorite throughout the industry and are sold throughout North America at many retailers from on-line big box stores to high-end specialty stores. The Jensen Castings team is made up of a skilled group of designers and artisans with a keen eye for original style and superior quality.

Benefits

Medical Insurance: Health, Dental and Vision plans are available

Health Reimbursement: We provide a generous health reimbursement when you reach your out-of-pocket health insurance deductible

401(k) Matching: Company matches for participating employees up to 4%

Holidays and Paid Time Off: We offer paid holidays and generous paid time off to support work-life balance

Insurance Options: Disability and Life insurance options available

Safety PPE Allowance: For safety footwear and prescription safety glasses

Weekly Pay: Enjoy the convenience of receiving your pay on a weekly basis

Profit Sharing: Available for eligible employees

Team Events: We celebrate our employees dedication through social gatherings

Employee Recognition: We celebrate and acknowledge the hard work and achievements of our team members

Training and Development: We offer opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth

Position Summary

We are seeking a dependable and highly organized Office Administrator to assist the Plant Manager with the daily operations of our manufacturing office. In this role, you will be responsible for coordinating interviews, greeting visitors, maintaining office supplies, managing general correspondence, and supporting inventory through data entry. Additionally, you will play a key role in new employee orientation, providing support with onboarding paperwork, and assisting employees throughout the onboarding process.

The Office Administrator will ensure a smooth workflow by performing various administrative duties that contribute to an efficient office environment. This position requires a detail-oriented individual with strong organizational skills, excellent communication abilities, and the capacity to manage multiple tasks effectively.

Essential Functions
Handle a variety of administrative duties such as greeting visitors, coordinating meetings, maintaining office supplies, and managing general correspondence
Provide data entry support to other departments as needed, helping ensure accuracy and consistency
Provide support to applicants throughout the staffing process, including scheduling interviews and assisting with application follow-ups
Conduct new hire onboarding for all new employees, including scheduling safety training with the safety consultant and ensuring all required documentation is completed
Track and record employee files in Paylocity, including employment applications, termination checklists, benefits information, and other relevant documents
Assist HR leadership in maintaining accurate personnel records, including but not limited to I-9 forms, worker's compensation records, incident files, and health files

Description:
ERP Administrator (Yardi)
Our client is a dynamic and forward-thinking organization dedicated to leveraging technology to enhance operations and deliver exceptional service in the commercial real estate industry. We are seeking a skilled ERP Administrator to manage and maintain the Yardi ERP system within the M365 environment.
The ideal candidate is a service-oriented professional responsible for ensuring the efficiency, security, and reliability of the ERP system. This role involves providing technical support, collaborating across departments to optimize performance, and driving continuous system improvements.
Key Responsibilities-ERP Administrator
System Administration: Configure, maintain, and optimize the Yardi ERP system, including module setup, updates, and overall system performance.
Technical Support: Troubleshoot system issues, provide end-user support, and ensure prompt resolution of access or functionality concerns.
Customization & Integration: Tailor Yardi modules to business needs and integrate with other enterprise systems.
Data Security & Management: Ensure data integrity, conduct regular audits, and manage system backups.
User Training: Develop training materials and conduct sessions to enhance user proficiency with Yardi functionalities.
Vendor Coordination: Work with Yardi and third-party vendors for system support, upgrades, and integrations.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive records of system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides.
Collaboration: Partner with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of Yardi with other business applications.
System Enhancements: Recommend improvements, upgrades, and emerging technologies to enhance ERP capabilities.
Reporting & Analytics: Develop and maintain custom reports within Yardi to support business operations.
Required Skills & Qualifications-ERP Administrator
Expertise in Yardi ERP systems with strong proficiency in M365 applications.
SQL database experience and ability to execute queries for data management.
Strong troubleshooting skills with a detail-oriented and analytical approach.
Excellent communication skills to train and support non-technical users.
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear, user-friendly explanations.
Service-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Yardi administrator and in business systems applications, preferably in large real estate or regulated environments.
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, or Computer Science (preferred).
Preferred Qualifications-ERP Administrator
Relevant ERP or IT certifications.
Project management experience with the ability to handle multiple priorities.
Knowledge of data security and compliance standards.
Title: ERP Adminstrator

The Applications Specialist (AS) will work in teams or independently to provide day-to-day support of Venturedyne software and technology. The AS will be able to wear many hats as there are ample opportunities for learning and growth at Venturedyne. The position provides one-on-one consultancy with users of the ERP Application System. The sky is the limit for learning and growth at Venturedyne.
This position is at the corporate headquarters for Venturedyne which is located in Pewaukee.

Perform analysis and diagnosis of software problems for end users and recommend implementation of corrective solutions for ERP software on the IBMi.
Function as a backup person for the IBMi Systems and Applications Manager.
Perform analysis and programming when required to enhance or repair the existing ERP software.
Learn and administer the divisional SQL Servers and the databases that relate to the ERP system.
Learn and administer the MS Servers hosting WebSphere Application Server which hosts the Graphical User Interface (GUI) for our ERP software.
Receive and respond to incoming calls or emails regarding software issues and training.
Technical documentation and other related documentation in conformance with established standards.
Maintaining proper backups using the BRMS (Backup, Recovery and Media Services) software.

Associate's OR Bachelor's degree in a computer-related field
Experience with the IBMi (programming and operating system)

SQL Server experience

Venturedyne offers a competitive benefits package.
Company Description
For the past 34 years Venturedyne has operated as a holding company of eight industrial manufacturing, sales and service companies. Our divisions manufacture and supply environmental testing, test system integration, screening and simulation equipment; HVAC equipment for sheet metal and mechanical contractors serving commercial, non-residential, and construction markets; and a line of magnetic separators and sweepers for applications, such as recycling, bulk processing, mining, concrete and demolition recycling, aggregate processing, and general industrial use.
We also manufacture Dings brakes for conveyors, door openers, machine drives, cranes, and a multitude of other applications that require rapid stopping and holding power; brick-making equipment, such as brick presses; and air and liquid particle counters that validate and monitor airborne particles in controlled production and service environments. Our diverse product base serves a variety of business sectors and we continue to successfully grow these businesses.
